runs.comm: goes back and plays the first ball turning slowly away from him towards mid-off
gets forward and drives to long-off
goes back and plays to cover
stays back and forces to long-off
hangs back and punches down the ground, Peterson gets a hand to it but can't cut it off
gets down on a knee and slogs across the line out to deep midwicket, tidy first over by South Africa
beaten outside off as he tries to cut
banged in on middle and leg and Guptill doesn't have much time to get under it but he manages to do so
good length ball on middle, straightens to take the outside edge as Guptill half-heartedly drives, beats the slips and the fielder diving on the rope at third man
swings cleanly through the line on leg and sends the on-drive over mid-on's head and down to the boundary, Guptill deciding to take the attack to Marchant
gets an inside edge into the pads and towards fine leg as the ball is fired in full on leg
short and wide down leg, beats Nicol's flick and AB is completely befuddled by the bounce, cops a blow on the end of the finger and it rolls away fine for more runs
forward and defends to point with an open face
stays in the crease and defends the slider on leg with a leading edge
gets down on bent knee and slog-sweeps a full toss on middle with excellent timing out to the backward square boundary
two boundaries in a row for Nicol, this was dragged down on leg and Nicol had ample time to rock back and pummel the pull through midwicket
goes back and whips off the hips through midwicket
backs away a touch and slams a full ball on middle down to long-off on the bounce
gets forward and works off the inner edge to backward square

stupendous shot there from Nicol, he walked across the stumps to a very full ball on middle and leg, had he missed it he was bowled, instead he flicked with quality timing that the fine leg fielder only moving a touch to his left couldn't stop from going to the rope
short on off and he misses the pull, hit high on the pad and it drops on the crease
bangs in a sharp bouncer on middle and off with Nicol walking down, misses the heave to leg and AB does superbly to take it diving high above his head

Nicol nearly repeats the first ball of the over, gets bat on ball with a slightly less closed face and gets this through backward square out to the boundary, these full yorkers are being countered expertly by Nicol
defends a short ball on off back down the pitch, de Lange threatens to throw it back
again Nicol sends a de Lange full ball on middle packing to backward square, Nicol loves the flick and he gets it absolutely right yet again
starts outside off and gets Guptill to edge down to third man
tucks a ball on middle and leg towards midwicket on the edge of the circle
slips this down leg, hits the thigh pad and zips past a diving AB to the fine leg fence
Guptill puts the head down to a length ball on middle and leg and lofts cleanly over his head and the ball flies back into the stands
this is fired well down leg and South Africa need to get a grip on proceedings
swings across the line to a full ball on middle and doesn't middle it but gets it behind square where there are no boundary patrollers
short outside off and Guptill is beaten trying to pull in front of square
and he is pummelled over the deep midwicket boundary first ball, short on leg and Nicol advances and happily slams it well beyond the rope
clipped from off stump into the leg side
this is into the pads and worked to the right of midwicket
pulls a short ball on middle without much timing above the head of square leg where Parnell dives high and gets a hand to it but can't hold on and technically dropsit, rolls away behind Parnell
worked off the pads
this is short on off and gets big on Nicol as he tries to pull, gets a top edge down to Levi at fine leg who struggles to see it in the floodlights and has to dive forward to take an important catch
stays back in the crease and defends his first ball down the pitch to Botha

well, run-out missed there, Ryder mistimed the work to leg, looked like it was heading past Botha who races across, Ryder was just strolling through, but Botha throws to the keeper but Guptill gets in the way and is hit on the back as he is rushing home, South Africa appeal for obstructing the field but Guptill never changed his line
gets forward and punches past short cover to long-off
charges down the track and tries to swing it over cover, gets a thick outside edge over the head of the fielder on the circle's edge which runs away to the third man boundary
this si slipped through wide past Ryder's flick
gets forward and mistimes a drive towards long-off

massive wicket for South Africa as Guptill holes out to Amla at long-off, it was turning into Guptill from off and he sliced the drive in the air flat without much power to Amla who held the catch well as he tumbled over
stays back in the crease and defends his first ball
McCullum shoulders arms to a ball outside off
the length was short which wasn't that bad, but combined with a leg-side line, the ball is not a good one and it clips the thigh pad and races to the fine leg fence
this is a good short ball on middle and Baz gets on top of it and plays it down through square leg
tries to ramp a short ball on the stumps over the slips, Ryder can't make contact, that was a fiery and well-directed bouncer
that is a Jesse Ryder special, gets down on one knee and slaps a full ball outside off through the covers and out to the rope
gets forward and solidly defends down the track
AB needed to do better there, it was turning down leg but he could have stopped it even as Baz was missing the flick, instead it runs away for runs South Africa can ill-afford to concede
gets forward and plays to midwicket
full outside off and gets forward and chips with a hint of leading edge past short cover
drives off the front foot into the covers
goes back and works through square leg
goes back and defends down the pitch
fired in full on off, Ryder gets a thick inside edge through square leg
half-volley outside off is crunched by McCullum, but fortunately for Parnell he finds long-off
short down leg and Ryder gleefully helps it on his way with a one-legged pull through backward square
full outside off and driven to the cover sweeper
the ludicrously short straight boundary sees another flat six, this is full on off and McCullum slams it at head height past the bowler and into the sightscreen
mistimes the cut down to long-off, end of a poor over by Parnell
defends on leg back down the pitch
wide outside off and plays to short cover
that is a long hop on leg stump and he pulls it dead straight to deep square leg
drives just out of extra cover's reach
full outside off and he eases it to long-off
charges down the track and goes for a massive heave, skies it high in the air on the off side and somehow it lands perfectly in the middle of three fielders haring after it
gets down and sweeps out to deep square
horrible swat by Ryder from outside off and he drags it to long-on
goes back and cuts it into the covers
tossed up on leg and milked behind square, New Zealand coasting now and it doesn't look like rain will be coming to South Africa's rescue

just as I say that and make a fool of myself, Brendon McCullum goes for a big swing at a short ball on off and it goes through to AB who juggles before claiming the catch, the finger goes up and McCullum doesn't seem to think he hit that but he has to go
goes back and plays into the off side
this one slides down leg, worked close to the pitch and no run is available
goes back and punches past short cover into the deep
goes back and Kane heaves his first ball to leg
cuts into the covers
Kane drives a full ball outside off into the deep on the off side
full toss on middle is worked to long-on
charges down the track and slams a tossed up delivery on middle straight back over Peterson's head and into the North Stand
goes back and clips off the pads through square leg
gets forward and plays back to the bowler
leans forward and works it to deep midwicket
comes down the track again on leg stump and lofts just out of long-on's reach for his second six of the over and the game
Kane works a short ball on off into the leg side off the back foot
banged in outside off and Ryder tries to bravely ramp it against the angle over the slips but can't connect
full outside off, goes for the booming drive and inside edges to fine leg, that was 146kph
this is short again but down leg and Kane raises his bat high to let it go and take th extra run and ball on offer
tucked into the deep on the leg side
backed away to a short ball outside off and ended up reaching for it before slapping it to the rope, it was inches short of earning him an extra couple of runs
drives nicely into the deep
and zips a short ball outside off past Kane's attempted defensive shot
that is too wide outside off and Kane's swing and miss is of little consequence as his team earns an extra run

and all of a sudden Kane completely misjudges the short ball on middle, it got way too big on him and he skied it high up to midwicket in close, Albie Morkel, who held on to give his brother the wicket
short on middle, backs away and cuts powerfully through backward point to the boundary
again backs away but this time mistimes the short ball into the off side
slips this down leg and it hits the pad, rolls fine
short on middle and Franklin gets on top of it nicely to work it behind square into the gap, that allows him to come back for a second
full outside off and guided to the left of cover
drives a full ball outside off down the ground
Ryder is hit on the pad on leg as he tries to flick
this hits Ryder on the pad on middle as he tries to sweep, height was the only issue and umpire Gaffaney rules him not out as a result, Virtual Eye suggest it was indeed going over the top
played back down the pitch
goes back and mistimes the chop into the covers, top over from Botha to keep the runs conceded to two
Franklin nudges a good length ball into the off side where the cover fielder misfields with Ryder struggling
banged in short outside off, ducks out of the way and Morne is unhappy as it is wided for height
mistimes the pull completely and it lobs to mid-on on the bounce, Ryder anxious to reach his half-century
full outside off and he can't get the drive past mid-on
Ryder wristily clips a ball on leg into open space through square leg to bring up his half-century on his comeback from 37 balls, the cult hero's popularity shows no signs of waning
short on leg and tucked into the wide mid-on area

oh my oh my oh my! I cannot believe he has dropped that, Ryder has skied the drive into orbit and Ontong is hanging around under it waiting for it to come down, when it does he is simply not anywhere near where he should be to take it and ends up reaching with his fingers before spilling it, that was fielding reminiscent of this summer's other African touristsd, Zimbabwe
comes down and jams a ball on leg to backward square
worked into the leg side and Franklin wants a couple but he is sent back by Ryder
full on leg and clipped away to deep midwicket, the home side doing this in singles at the moment
outside off and very slow, mistimes the drive back to Botha, South Africa just placing New Zealand under some pressure here

and that was a poor shot by Ryder, he walked across the stumps and tried to lap it over his shoulder but ended up scooping it to Morne on the edge of the circle, can South Africa pull off the unthinkable?
full on the pads and Franklin works it to deep midwicket for a single, New Zealand need 7 from the final over
Franklin drills a full ball outside off on the bounce to long-off
short and wide outside off, beats the cut and he is shocked that the umpire hasn't called wide, New Zealand all of a sudden struggling

now they are in full-blown panic mode, moved across way outside off and tried to paddle pull, got a glove on it and it skied up to AB behind the stumps, are the home team going to do what their opposition is usually accused of doing?
bangs in a bouncer on middle, risky considering if it hits bat it's probably flying away, but in the end it pays off as Bracewell can't connect with a big swing

South Africa should win this now as Bracewell goes for an almighty slog to leg as the ball is full on off, skied high in the air and settles in the hands of Amla at point and he ends up diving forward to take it

would you believe it? he's bowled a front-foot no-ball, it was full outside off and Franklin hit it along the ground to long-off, the South Africans begin celebrating only to look up in horror at the standing umpire, they managed to take a single as well

de Lange holds his nerve, fires it in outside off and Southee misses with the swing to leg, AB collects and runs up to the stumps to prevent any runs and South Africa have pulled off an absolute stunner at Eden Park
